data.Name: Ophiuchus
data.Story: The serpent bearer; in Greek mythology, Asclepius, the god of medicine, depicted in the sky holding the snake Serpens.

data.Name: Scutum
data.Story: The shield; a constellation honouring King John III Sobieski of Poland – the only politically inspired constellation still in use.

data.Name: Lupus
data.Story: The wolf; an ancient constellation, but without mythological association.

data.Name: Horologium
data.Story: The pendulum clock; a modern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Mensa
data.Story: Table Mountain, South Africa; a modern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756, celebrating his southern-hemisphere observing site.

data.Name: Indus
data.Story: The Indian; introduced as a constellation by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Musca
data.Story: The fly; a constellation introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Pisces
data.Story: Two fishes, swimming in opposite directions with their tails connected by a cord.

data.Name: Pegasus
data.Story: The winged horse; in Greek mythology, used by Zeus to carry thunder and lightning.

data.Name: Lepus
data.Story: The hare; often depicted being chased by Orion and his two dogs.

data.Name: Sagittarius
data.Story: The archer; usually drawn as a centaur – half man, half horse

data.Name: Volans
data.Story: The flying fish; a constellation introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598, celebrating the family Exocoetidae.

data.Name: Telescopium
data.Story: The telescope; a modern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Tucana
data.Story: The toucan; a constellation introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Ursa Minor
data.Story: The lesser bear; in Greek mythology, one of the nymphs that nursed Zeus as an infant.

data.Name: Ursa Major
data.Story: The great bear, also known as the Big Dipper or the Plough. In Greek mythology, Callisto, lover of Zeus.

data.Name: Triangulum
data.Story: The triangle; appearing similar to a capital delta in the Greek alphabet.

data.Name: Serpens
data.Story: The serpent's head; held by Ophiuchus and part of the same constellation as Serpens Cauda. The serpent's tail; held by Ophiuchus and part of the same constellation as Serpens Caput.

data.Name: Vulpecula
data.Story: The fox; a constellation introduced by Johannes Hevelius in 1687.

data.Name: Gemini
data.Story: The mythical twins Castor and Pollux.

data.Name: Dorado
data.Story: The goldfish; a constellation introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Caelum
data.Story: The chisel; a southern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Columba
data.Story: The dove; introduced by Plancius in 1592. In Biblical history, said to be the dove of Noah.

data.Name: Grus
data.Story: The crane; a constellation introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Canis Minor
data.Story: The lesser dog; in Greek mythology, a hunting dog belonging to Orion, depicted pursuing the hare Lepus.

data.Name: Equuleus
data.Story: The little horse; a tiny yet ancient constellation with no mythological association.

data.Name: Eridanus
data.Story: The mythical river Eridanus; associated variously with the Nile or Po.

data.Name: Hercules
data.Story: Hercules; a large yet dark constellation representing the greatest hero of Greek mythology.

data.Name: Crux
data.Story: The southern cross; introduced as a constellation by Plancius in 1598.

data.Name: Cygnus
data.Story: The swan; in Greek mythology, Zeus in disguise.

data.Name: Hydrus
data.Story: The lesser water snake; introduced as a constellation by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Canes Venatici
data.Story: The hunting dogs; introduced by Johannes Hevelius in 1687, and said to be held by the herdsman Bootes.

data.Name: Corona Australis
data.Story: The southern crown, lying at the feet of Sagittarius, and known to the Greeks as a wreath.

data.Name: Corona Borealis
data.Story: The northern crown; in Greek mythology, worn by the Princess Ariadne on her wedding day.

data.Name: Leo Minor
data.Story: The lion cub; introduced as a constellation by Johannes Hevelius in 1687.

data.Name: Lynx
data.Story: The lynx; a faint constellation introduced by Johannes Hevelius in 1687.

data.Name: Leo
data.Story: The lion of Nemea; in Greek mythology, a monster slain by Hercules.

data.Name: Lyra
data.Story: The lyre; often said to be played by Orpheus, the greatest musician of his age.

data.Name: Sculptor
data.Story: The sculptor – originally, the sculptor's studio; a modern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Monoceros
data.Story: The unicorn; a constellation introduced by Plancius in 1612.

data.Name: Triangulum Australe
data.Story: The southern triangle; a constellation introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Microscopium
data.Story: The microscope; a modern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Phoenix
data.Story: The phoenix; a constellation introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Piscis Austrinus
data.Story: The southern fish; the parent of the two fish depicted by Pisces.

data.Name: Virgo
data.Story: The virgin; in Greek mythology, the goddess of justice.

data.Name: Sagitta
data.Story: The arrow; in Greek mythology, perhaps the arrow that Apollo used to kill the Cyclopes.

data.Name: Perseus
data.Story: Perseus; in Greek mythology, the husband of Andromeda, also known for slaying Medusa the Gorgon.

data.Name: Carina
data.Story: The keel; a sub-division of the ancient constellation Argo – in Greek mythology, the ship of the Argonauts.

data.Name: Canis Major
data.Story: The greater dog; in Greek mythology, a hunting dog belonging to Orion, depicted pursuing the hare Lepus.

data.Name: Auriga
data.Story: The charioteer; in Greek mythology, Erichthonius, son of Vulcan, the first person to attach four horses to a chariot.

data.Name: Aquila
data.Story: The eagle; in Greek mythology, the bird of Zeus and the retriever of his thunderbolts.

data.Name: Cepheus
data.Story: King Cepheus of Ethiopeia; in Greek mythology, the king of Ethiopia, descended from Zeus and Io.

data.Name: Circinus
data.Story: The pair of dividing compasses; a modern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Ara
data.Story: The altar; in Greek mythology, used by the Gods to vow allegiance before their battle with the Titans.

data.Name: Camelopardalis
data.Story: The giraffe; a large but faint northern constellation introduced by Plancius in 1612.

data.Name: Cetus
data.Story: The sea monster, which in Greek mythology attacked Cepheus's territory and Andromeda, but which was slain by Perseus.

data.Name: Coma Berenices
data.Story: The hair of Queen Berenice of Egypt; introduced as a constellation by Vopel in 1536.

data.Name: Fornax
data.Story: The furnace; originally a chemist's distillation furnace, introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Hydra
data.Story: The multi-headed water snake, slain by Hercules in Greek mythology.

data.Name: Libra
data.Story: The balance; a zodiacal constellation introduced by the Romans.

data.Name: Crater
data.Story: The cup; in Greek mythology, clutched by the crow Crater in its search for water.

data.Name: Lacerta
data.Story: The lizard; introduced as a constellation by Johannes Hevelius in 1690.

data.Name: Delphinus
data.Story: The dolphin; in Greek mythology, the messenger of Poseidon.

data.Name: Corvus
data.Story: The crow; in Greek mythology, sent by Apollo in search of water.

data.Name: Draco
data.Story: The dragon; in Greek mythology, Ladon, guard of the tree on which golden apples grew, slain by Hercules.

data.Name: Cancer
data.Story: The crab; in Greek mythology, a crab which bit Hercules's foot.

data.Name: Centaurus
data.Story: The Centaur: half man and half horse; in Greek mythology, the wise centaur Chiron.

data.Name: Cassiopeia
data.Story: Queen Cassiopeia; in Greek mythology, wife of Cepheus and mother of Andromeda.

data.Name: Apus
data.Story: The bird of paradise; a southern constellation introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Chamaeleon
data.Story: The chameleon; introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Antlia
data.Story: The air pump; a southern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756, originally the 'pneumatic machine'.

data.Name: Aquarius
data.Story: The water bearer; in Greek mythology, Ganymede, wine-waiter to the Gods and lover of Zeus.

data.Name: Capricornus
data.Story: The sea goat; associated with Pan in Greek mythology, god of the countryside.

data.Name: Andromeda
data.Story: The Princess Andromeda; in Greek mythology, the daughter of Cepheus and Cassiopeia and wife of Perseus.

data.Name: Bootes
data.Story: The herdsman; in Greek mythology, Arcas, son of Zeus by Callisto.

data.Name: Aries
data.Story: The ram; in Greek mythology, the animal whose golden fleece was recovered by Jason and the Argonauts.

data.Name: Puppis
data.Story: The poop deck of the Argo Navis; a sub-division of the ancient constellation Argo – in Greek mythology, the ship of the Argonauts.

data.Name: Scorpius
data.Story: The scorpion; said to have stung the hunter Orion to death in Greek mythology.

data.Name: Orion
data.Story: The hunter; associated in Greek mythology with a son of Poseidon, but associated by the Sumerians with their great hero Gilgamesh.

data.Name: Octans
data.Story: The octant, a navigational instrument invented in the 1730s. A modern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Pictor
data.Story: The painter's easel; a modern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Reticulum
data.Story: The net; a southern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756, commemorating the cross-hair in his telescope.

data.Name: Pyxis
data.Story: The compass; a southern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Norma
data.Story: The set square; a modern constellation introduced by Lacaille in 1756.

data.Name: Pavo
data.Story: The peacock; a constellation introduced by Keyser & de Houtman in 1598.

data.Name: Sextans
data.Story: The sextant; a constellation introduced by Johannes Hevelius in 1687, celebrating an instrument used to measure star positions.

data.Name: Vela
data.Story: The sail; a sub-division of the ancient constellation Argo – in Greek mythology, the ship of the Argonauts.

data.Name: Taurus
data.Story: The bull; said by the Sumerians to be charging at Orion the hunter, but in Greek mythology said to be Zeus in disguise.
